task.title: Viewing MQ Connectivity statistics by using the
task.shortdesc: System administrators can view destination mapping rule-related statistics by using the MQ Connectivity monitor in the .

context.p: You can view destination mapping rule statistics by using the , or by using a . For more information about using a to view destination mapping rule statistics, see . For more information about the predefined queries that you can run, see MQ Connectivity monitoring.

You can use the hover help over Status to view more information about why a particular rule might be unavailable or restarting. A status of Enabled usually indicates that the rule is operating normally. However, it is possible that messages might not be published for other reasons. For example, a connected client might not be authorized to publish on a particular topic.

step.cmd: From the , select Monitoring MQ Connectivity.
Enter a value into Rule Name. The default value is *.
Enter a value into Queue Manager Connection. The default value is *.
Enter a value into Rule Type. The default value is Any.
Enter a value into Query to select the predefined query that you want to run. The default value is Rules with most commit operations.
Click Refresh to generate the output in the table.
You can change the number of rules that are added to the table by selecting a value of 10, 25, 50, or 100.
Enter a value into Filter, and click Apply Filter, and then click Refresh to change the visibility of the MQTT client data that is shown in the table.

result.p: The Timestamp is updated to show the time that query is generated.
The table is updated to display the results of the query and any filter that is applied to those results.
